result.execSummary:
The defendant Eltag A Abusam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same
The Court approves probation to be served in Milwaukee County or any other approved Wisconsin County or Illinois.

miscConds.notes: The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over period of probation; any balance converted into civil judgment. Upon revocation to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant. Restitution set at zero.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession; Voting.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with the Department.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Provide DNA sample--pay surcharge from bail on deposit with balance over period of probation.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eltag A Abusam

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eltag A Abusam in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Megan P Carmody for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, with credit for 5 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 months; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 months.  This sentence is stayed and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 3 years.  Upon revocation, the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   The court approves probation to be served in Milwaukee County or any other approved Wisconsin County or Illinois
Terms of probation and extended supervision:
-serve 90 days HOC, forthwith-good time to apply
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Seek and maintain full time employment
Restitution set at zero
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge from bail on deposit with balance due over period of probation; any balance converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over period of probation; any balance converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eltag A Abusam in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Defendant advised of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession / Voting.  Court orders continued compliance with JPoint.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw
Defendant Eltag A Abusam in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Eltag A Abusam in court with Trisha Fritz, student intern under the supervision of Steve Sargent for attorney Debra J Patterson.  Tyrone St. Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/18/14.

Defendant Eltag A Abusam in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Eltag A Abusam in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
